page.title: 17Transport
page.content: In 1985 the car is our main form of transportation.Buses are for people who don't own cars or motor-bikes.You pay the driver some money and he will take you to anywhere on his route.Most families own cars or some form of transport but some just walk.If there is no bus service to the place that you want to go,you can call a taxi.The driver will take you where you want to go,and will charge you according to the distance.Many people in our area own bicycles because it is flat,and they use no fuel. For long distances,there are trains,which are powered by diesel or electricity.They run on steel rails at speeds of up to 125m.p.h.There are two stations in Gainsborough.Lea Road is the main one.Very few trains stop at the Central Station.
